channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: GB set new Games gold record while France celebrate
item.description: Great Britain continue their most successful start to a summer Olympics - reaching nine golds after seven days for the first time ever at the Games.

item.title: Marchand wins fourth gold as GB's Scott & Proud claim silver
item.description: Leon Marchand wins a sensational fourth Olympic gold in the Paris pool, beating Duncan Scott into second place moments after Ben Proud also won silver for Team GB.

item.title: Boxing controversy - what we know and what we don't
item.description: The IOC's decision to allow the entry of two athletes, that are said to have failed gender eligibility tests, has proved controversial.

item.title: Paris 2024: What you can expect to watch on Saturday
item.description: Our guide to what sports you can expect to watch and when on the BBC on Tuesday.

item.title: 31 gold medals up for grabs - Saturday's key events in Paris
item.description: Your day-by-day guide to what is happening when - and who to watch out for - at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

item.title: Page completes Olympic medal set with trampoline gold
item.description: Great Britain's Bryony Page wins gold in the final of the women's trampoline at the Olympics, to complete her set after silver in Rio and bronze in Tokyo.

item.title: GB's team jumpers near-faultless to secure Olympic gold
item.description: Scott Brash joins team-mates Ben Maher and Harry Charles with a clear round in the team jumping final to secure gold for Great Britain at Paris 2024.

item.title: 'Champions forever!' - rowing gold for GB's Craig & Grant
item.description: Great Britain's Emily Craig and Imogen Grant win gold in the last Olympic women's lightweight double sculls, after narrowly missing out on a medal in Tokyo.

item.title: GB's Scott wins silver as Marchand storms to gold
item.description: Watch as Great Britain's Duncan Scott wins silver in the men's 200m individual medley behind France's Leon Marchand on day seven of the Paris 2024 Olympics.

item.title: 'Bedlam in Bordeaux' - Scuffles break out at end of France-Argentina game
item.description: Watch as scuffles break out between the teams after the final whistle of the quarter-final match that saw France beat Argentina 1-0 on day seven of the Paris 2024 Olympics.

item.title: Page wins Team GB's first trampoline gold
item.description: Bryony Page wins Great Britain's first trampoline Olympic gold to complete her set of a medal of every colour.

item.title: GB win team jumping gold for first time since 2012
item.description: Great Britain win Olympic team jumping gold for the first time since London 2012 with a near-faultless performance in Paris.

item.title: Hodgkinson makes winning start to Olympic title bid
item.description: Great Britain's Keely Hodgkinson makes a winning start to her Olympic 800m title bid as Joshua Cheptegei claims the first track gold at Paris 2024 in the 10,000m.

item.title: Khelif being in women's boxing not fair, says next opponent
item.description: Hungarian boxer Anna Luca Hamori says she doesn't "think it's fair" that her next opponent, Imane Khelif, is in the women's category.

item.title: What next for Murray after his retirement?
item.description: On Friday, Andy Murray began life as a retired tennis player. BBC Sport looks at how he will spend the near future and what the longer term might hold.

item.title: GB's Proud wins 'brilliant' 50m freestyle silver
item.description: Watch as Great Britain's Ben Proud wins a "brilliant" silver medal in the men's 50m freestyle final on day seven of the Paris 2024 Olympics.

item.title: Craig & Grant cruise to gold after men win silver
item.description: Emily Craig and Imogen Grant win Great Britain’s second rowing gold of the Paris Olympics with a commanding performance in the women’s lightweight double sculls.

item.title: Ugly scenes as France edge out Argentina in quarter-final
item.description: France set up an Olympic men's football semi-final with Egypt by beating Argentina 1-0 in the quarter-finals.

item.title: Hull KR stun Warrington to go top of Super League
item.description: Hull KR produce an outstanding display to leapfrog Warrington Wolves and go top of the Super League.

item.title: West Ham agree £27m fee to sign Germany's Fullkrug
item.description: West Ham agree a fee worth £27m to sign Germany striker Niclas Fullkrug from Borussia Dortmund.

item.title: Watch: Australian trampoline gymnast takes heavy fall
item.description: Watch as Australian trampoline gymnast Brock Batty takes a heavy fall in qualifying on day seven of the Paris 2024 Olympics.

item.title: Swimmer Potocka 'fine' after post-race collapse
item.description: Slovakian swimmer Tamara Potocka is "fine", her team says, after collapsing following her 200m medley heat at the Paris Olympics.

item.title: Who to watch out for as Scottish Premiership kicks off
item.description: There are plenty of new faces who will be attracting attention as the Scottish Premiership season begins this weekend.

item.title: Djokovic sets up Olympic final with Alcaraz
item.description: Novak Djokovic will face Carlos Alcaraz in Saturday's men's singles gold-medal match, which will be a repeat of last month's Wimbledon final.

item.title: Bayern reject Man Utd's double bid - Saturday's gossip
item.description: Bayern Munich reject a joint bid from Manchester United for Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui, Newcastle to discuss new deal with Anthony Gordon, plus more.

item.title: Pooran powers Superchargers to win over Invincibles
item.description: Nicholas Pooran's unbeaten 65 proves the difference as Northern Superchargers claim a 19-run win over Oval Invincibles in The Hundred men's competition.

item.title: Lin wins controversial first bout at Paris Olympics
item.description: Taiwanese boxer Lin Yu-ting, whose inclusion in Paris 2024 has sparked controversy, wins her first bout of the Games.

item.title: GB's Laugher & Harding win synchro 3m bronze
item.description: Jack Laugher and Anthony Harding claim a fine bronze for Great Britain in synchronised 3m springboard diving at the Olympic Games in Paris.

item.title: Croatia comeback edges George and Wynne-Griffith into silver
item.description: Team GB's men's pair of Tom George and Ollie Wynne-Griffith are overtaken just before the finish line to leave them with a silver medal in the rowing at Paris 2024.

item.title: Laugher and Harding win 3m synchro diving bronze
item.description: Jack Laugher and Anthony Harding win bronze in the men's 3m synchronised springboard behind gold medallists China and an inspired Mexican pair at Paris 2024.

item.title: Watch: Palace's Mateta fires France to victory against Argentina
item.description: Watch as Crystal Palace striker Jean-Philippe Mateta scores the winner as France beat Argentina 1-0 in their quarter-final match on day seven of the Paris 2024 Olympics.

item.title: GB's Reekie, Gill & Hodgkinson reach 800m semi-finals
item.description: Watch as Great Britain's Jemma Reekie, Phoebe Gill and Keely Hodgkinson qualify for the women's 800m semi-finals after finishing in the top three of their heats on day seven of the Paris 2024 Olympics.

item.title: Sutherland & Pooran star - The Hundred plays of the day
item.description: Watch the best of the day's play as Oval Invincibles take on Northern Superchargers on day 11 of The Hundred.

item.title: Watch: GB cruise into mixed 4x400m relay final
item.description: Watch as Great Britain's track athletes qualify for the 4x400m mixed relay final after winning their qualifying heat on day seven of the Paris 2024 Olympics.

item.title: USA set 4x400m mixed relay world record
item.description: Watch as the USA set a new world record in their 4x400m mixed relay heat to qualify for the final on day seven of the Paris 2024 Olympics.

item.title: 'Absolute class!' France judo legend Riner wins fourth Olympic gold
item.description: Watch as France's Teddy Riner demonstrates his "absolute class" to win the four Olympic gold of his career with victory in the men's +100kg judo final on day seven of the Paris 2024.

item.title: 'What a race!' - France win all three men's BMX racing medals
item.description: Watch as France's Joris Daudet, Sylvain Andre and Romain Mahieu take the gold, silver and bronze medals in the men's BMX racing final on day seven of the Paris 2024 Olympics.

item.title: GB's Fleetwood shares lead but McIlroy six back
item.description: Great Britain's Tommy Fleetwood moves into contention for a medal in the Olympic men's golf event with a second-round 64 but Rory McIlroy fails to mount a charge.

item.title: Shriever eighth after GB team-mate Whyte crashes
item.description: Bethany Shriever's Olympic title defence ends in disappointment as she finishes last in BMX racing final in Paris.

item.title: Convicted rapist Van de Velde booed loudly during defeat
item.description: Convicted child rapist Steven van de Velde is loudly booed when playing for the Netherlands in their beach volleyball defeat by Norway at the Olympics.

item.title: Fulham sign Smith Rowe from Arsenal for club record fee
item.description: Fulham announce the club record signing of Arsenal midfielder Emile Smith Rowe for an initial £27m fee.

item.title: I want to apologise to Khelif - Italian boxer Carini
item.description: Angela Carini says she "wants to apologise" to Algerian boxer Imane Khelif after there was no handshake at the end of their Olympic fight.

item.title: Newcastle approach Palace over Guehi deal
item.description: Newcastle United approach Crystal Palace about signing England centre-back Marc Guehi.

item.title: Raducanu knocked out of Washington Open by Badosa
item.description: Emma Raducanu is beaten by Paula Badosa in three sets as she is knocked out of the Washington Open in the quarter-finals.

item.title: The gold & silver medals that will not be in Olympic table
item.description: Ivan Litvinovich and Viyaleta Bardzilouskaya know they have won Olympic medals, but will not be shown in the official medal table - this is why.

item.title: Clement backs 'longer term' Rangers plan with new deal
item.description: Rangers manager Philippe Clement signs a contract extension until the summer of 2028.

item.title: GB face Germany in BJK Finals opener
item.description: Great Britain face Germany in their opening game of the Billie Jean King Cup finals on 15 November in Malaga.

item.title: 51 moves and going strong at 45 - meet football's ultimate journeyman
item.description: As he gets ready to embark on yet another season, BBC Sport meets Jefferson Louis - football's ultimate journeyman - who has changed clubs a remarkable 51 times.

item.title: Big Evs edges Asfoora to win King George Stakes
item.description: Big Evs edges a sprint finish with Asfoora to win the King George Stakes at Goodwood.

item.title: Man Utd sign Sweden full-back Sandberg from Hacken
item.description: Manchester United sign Sweden defender Anna Sandberg on a three-year deal with an option for a further season.

item.title: 'Celtic hold all the aces at home amid clamour for more ambition'
item.description: Celtic begin the quest for yet another title in a position of strength but manager Brendan Rodgers "does not want to live in a comfort zone", writes Tom English.

item.title: Ten Hag Q&A: Man Utd boss has 'left behind' job review
item.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag answers questions from BBC Sport's Simon Stone on the 'football review' and his hopes for the new season.

item.title: Crawford should be 'American superstar' - Hearn
item.description: Terence Crawford should be considered an "American superstar" Eddie Hearn says - but he is hopeful his fighter Israil Madrimov will triumph on Saturday.

item.title: Canada fail in appeal for medal after Valieva doping ban
item.description: Canada fail in an appeal to be awarded a bronze medal from the 2022 Winter Olympic team figure skating event.

item.title: Former NI & Newcastle midfielder Cassidy dies at 73
item.description: Former Newcastle United midfielder Tommy Cassidy, a member of Northern Ireland's 1982 World Cup squad, dies aged 73.

item.title: Neville acquires Lim's Salford City stake
item.description: Gary Neville acquires Peter Lim's interest in Salford City, "paving the way for a new strategic partner", the League Two club has said.

item.title: Glover yet to decide on future after Olympic silver
item.description: Helen Glover says she has yet to make a decision on whether she will retire from rowing after winning a silver medal in the women's four.

item.title: 'I have to earn spot' - Ferguson has no plans to retire
item.description: Tony Ferguson says he has no plans to retire after his fight on Saturday, but knows he must earn his spot in the UFC.

item.title: Race, respect and reputation
item.description: Linford Christie looks back on his extraordinary career, from the highs to the lows

item.title: Intense sci-fi thriller featuring George Clooney
item.description: Two astronauts become stranded in space and must find a way to return to Earth

item.title: The journey to becoming a sporting legend
item.description: Over 20 years of behind-the-scenes footage exploring Andy Murray’s incredible career

item.title: 'Tears everywhere as British icon Murray departs'
item.description: Andy Murray was understandably emotional as his illustrious career came to a close at the Paris 2024 Olympics - but he wasn't the only one.

item.title: Three things we learned from Arsenal's America tour
item.description: Arsenal have Manchester City in their sights in the new Premier League season, says chief football news reporter Simon Stone.

item.title: Who are Team GB's medal winners at Paris 2024?
item.description: Read about and watch the medal moments for Team GB at the Paris Olympics 2024.

item.title: Quiz: How well do you know Team GB's athletes?
item.description: The Paris Olympics are getting under way, but how well do you remember Team GB successes from Games gone by? Try our quiz.

item.title: The 24 British stars to watch at Paris 2024
item.description: From Olympic golden oldies to fresh-faced debutants, BBC Sport picks out 24 of the Team GB athletes to particularly focus on during Paris 2024.

item.title: The people v Andy Murray: Four weeks that changed him and us
item.description: In the space of a month in 2012, Andy Murray went from tears in the rain to gold in the sunshine, winning hearts and medals on Centre Court.

item.title: An Olympic friendship that defied Hitler
item.description: Jesse Owens and Luz Long's embrace has become a defining image of Olympic sportsmanship, but it came with consequences.

item.title: Inside the gym building champions - and community
item.description: Molly McCann and Paddy Pimblett are MMA superstars but their Liverpool gym focuses on fighters of all abilities

item.title: Chasing the 'Ghost' - a superstar struck down by lightning
item.description: John White did the League and Cup Double, but his sudden death left his son searching for the man behind the comic-book persona.

item.title: Fuelling the Tour de France: Secrets of the team kitchens
item.description: Replacing the 6,000 calories burned daily by a Tour de France rider, while negotiating the vaguaries and motorways of a 21-stage, 2,100 mile race is a formidable challenge.

item.title: Panenka - the penalty that killed a career and started a feud
item.description: Antonin Panenka's penalty in the Euro 1976 final birthed a whole new 12-yard tactic. But the risks were higher than anyone could imagine.

item.title: Running on a volcano's rim - the race in the shadow of an eruption
item.description: In 2021, La Palma's volcanos erupted, issuing tonnes of molten rock and a reminder of the perilious nature of the island's premier running race.

item.title: Slade to miss start of Premiership season after surgery
item.description: England centre Henry Slade will miss the start of the Premiership season after undergoing shoulder surgery.

item.title: Marchand & Macron grab attention, but Scott makes own mark
item.description: French president Emmanuel Macron and swimming superstar Leon Marchand were centre of attention, but Duncan Scott makes history of his own.

item.title: Wales' fastest man chasing medals and memories in Paris
item.description: Jeremiah Azu is the only Welshman in history to have run 100 metres in less than 10 seconds and now has his sights on Paris 2024 success.

item.title: McClenaghan goes for gold - What is happening on day eight?
item.description: BBC Sport NI takes a look at what is happening on day eight of the Olympics as Rhys McClenaghan goes for gold in the pommel horse.
